quote: Every idea I get I have to deny, that's my way of testing it.
author: Alain, Histoire de mes pensées

quote: The creative is the place where no one else has ever been. You have to leave the city of your comfort and go into the wilderness of your intuition.
author: Alan Alda

quote: All great deeds and all great thoughts have a ridiculous beginning. Great works are often born on a street corner or in a restaurant’s revolving door.
author: Albert Camus

quote: I know quite certainly that I myself have no special talent; curiosity, obsession and dogged endurance, combined with self-criticism, have brought me to my ideas.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: If at first, the idea is not absurd, then there is no hope for it.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Why is it I always get my best ideas while shaving?
author: Albert Einstein

quote: I know quite certainly that I myself have no special talent. Curiosity, obsession and dogged endurance, combined with self-criticism, have brought me to my ideas.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: If I have a thousand ideas and only one turns out to be good, I am satisfied.
author: Alfred Bernhard Nobel

quote: Ideas Won't Keep. Something Must Be Done About Them.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Every really new idea looks crazy at first.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Almost all really new ideas have a certain aspect of foolishness when they are just produced.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Some people use things; they destroy. You’re a creator, a builder.
author: Amelia Atwater-Rhodes

quote: My ideas usually come not at my desk writing but in the midst of living.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Often the difference between a successful person and a failure is not one has better abilities or ideas, but the courage that one has to bet on one’s ideas, to take a calculated risk – and to act.
author: Andre Malraux

quote: Don’t be afraid of new ideas. Be afraid of old ideas. They keep you where you are and stop you from growing and moving forward. Concentrate on where you want to go, not on what you fear.
author: Anthony Robbins

quote: A pile of rocks ceases to be a rock pile the moment someone contemplates it with the idea of a cathedral in mind.
author: Antoine De St-Exupery

quote: An idea not coupled with action will never get any bigger than the brain cell it occupied.
author: Arnold H. Glasgow

quote: New ideas pass through three periods: 1) It can’t be done. 2) It probably can be done, but it’s not worth doing. 3) I knew it was a good idea all along!
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: New ideas pass through three periods: 1) It can't be done; 2) It probably can be done, but it's not worth doing; 3) I knew it was a good idea all along!
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: Good ideas are common – what’s uncommon are people who’ll work hard enough to bring them about.
author: Ashleigh Brilliant

quote: My mind contains many good ideas, but it's not always easy to squeeze one out.
author: Ashleigh Brilliant

quote: A half-baked idea is okay as long as it's in the oven.
author: Author Unknown

quote: No matter who you are, some scholar can show you the great idea you had was had by someone before you.
author: Author Unknown

quote: Believe in something larger than yourself. . . . Get involved in the big ideas of your time.
author: Barbara Bush

quote: You can imprison a man, but not an idea. You can exile a man, but not an idea. You can kill a man, but not an idea.
author: Benazir Bhutto

quote: Ideas are like wandering sons. They show up when you least expect them.
author: Bern Williams

quote: The ability to express an idea is well nigh as important as the idea itself.
author: Bernard Baruch

quote: We think good ideas to death, when we should be acting them to life.
author: Brian G. Jett

quote: An idea that is developed and put into action is more important than an idea that exists only as an idea.
author: Buddha

quote: Everyone is in love with their own ideas.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Night time is really the best time to work. All the ideas are there to be yours because everyone else is asleep.
author: Catherine O'Hara

quote: An idea, like a ghost, must be spoken to a little before it will explain itself.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: If you want to kill any idea in the world, get a committee working on it.
author: Charles Kettering

quote: It is the essence of genius to make use of the simplest ideas.
author: Charles Peguy

quote: The ideas I stand for are not mine. I borrowed them from Socrates. I swiped them from Chesterfield. I stole them from Jesus. And I put them in a book. If you don't like their rules, whose would you use?
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: The problem is never how to get new, innovative thoughts into your mind, but how to get old ones out.
author: Dee Hock

quote: An idea is not responsible for the people who believe in it.
author: Don Marquis

quote: Everything Begins With An Idea.
author: Earl Nightengale

quote: Exploration is the engine that drives innovation. Innovation drives economic growth. So let’s all go exploring.
author: Edith Widder

quote: The brain is a commodity used to fertilize ideas.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: An idea that is not dangerous is unworthy to be called an idea at all.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Great minds discuss ideas. Average minds discuss events. Small minds discuss people.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Nothing is more dangerous than an idea when it is the only one you have.
author: Emile Chartier

quote: Conditions for creativity are to be puzzled; to concentrate; to accept conflict and tension; to be born every day; to feel a sense of self.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: No grand idea was ever born in a conference, but a lot of foolish ideas have died there.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: There is only one way in which a person acquires a new idea: by the combination or association of two or more ideas he already has into a new juxtaposition in such a manner as to discover a relationship among them of which he was not previously aware.
author: Francis A. Cartier

quote: An Idea Is Salvation By Imagination.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: We often refuse to accept an idea merely because the tone of voice in which it has been expressed is unsympathetic to us.
author: Friedrich Nietzche

quote: Everyone is a genius at least once a year. The real geniuses simply have their bright ideas closer together.
author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

quote: If you have an apple and I have an apple and we exchange these apples then you and I will still each have one apple. But if you have an idea and I have an idea and we exchange these ideas, then each of us will have two ideas.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Creativity can solve almost any problem. The creative act, the defeat of habit by originality, overcomes everything.
author: George Lois

quote: Human history is, in essence, a history of ideas.
author: H.G. Wells

quote: Capital isn’t that important in business. Experience isn’t that important. You can get both of these things. What is important is ideas.
author: Harvey S. Firestone

quote: Drawing is putting a line round an idea.
author: Henri Matisse

quote: The air is full of ideas. They are knocking you in the head all the time. You only have to know what you want, then forget it, and go about your business. Suddenly, the idea will come through. It was there all the time.
author: Henry Ford

quote: The ability to convert ideas to things is the secret of outward success.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Don’t worry about people stealing your ideas. If your ideas are any good, you’ll have to ram them down people’s throats.
author: Howard Aiken

quote: Good ideas are not adopted automatically. They must be driven into practice with courageous patience.
author: Hyman Rickover

quote: Ideas have become far more important to us than action - ideas so cleverly expressed in books by the intellectuals in every field. The more cunning, the more subtle, those ideas are the more we worship them and the books that contain them. We are those books, we are those ideas, so heavily conditioned are we by them. We are forever discussing ideas and ideals and dialectically offering opinions. Every religion has its dogma, its formula, its own scaffold to reach the gods, and when inquiring into the beginning of thought we are questioning the importance of this whole edifice of ideas. We have separated ideas from action because ideas are always of the past and action is always the present - that is, living is always the present. We are afraid of living and therefore the past, as ideas, has become so important to us.
author: J. Krishnamurti

quote: Crystal ideas are often broken by the grapple with words.
author: James Lendall Basford

quote: New ideas are but gathered fragments from the past.
author: James Lendall Basford (1845–1915), Seven Seventy Seven Sensations, 1897

quote: Good ideas often take wings and fly beyond our reach, while bad ones will cling to us like barnacles to a vessel.
author: James Lendall Basford (1845–1915), Sparks from the Philosopher's Stone, 1882

quote: Just because you're a musician doesn't mean all your ideas are about music. So every once in a while I get an idea about plumbing, I get an idea about city government, and they come the way they come.
author: Jerry Garcia

quote: Ideas can be life-changing. Sometimes all you need to open the door is just one more good idea.
author: Jim Rohn

quote: Labor gives birth to ideas.
author: Jim Rohn

quote: Daring ideas are like chessmen moved forward; they may be beaten, but they may start a winning game.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: I can't understand why people are frightened of new ideas. I'm frightened of the old ones.
author: John Cage

quote: A man may die, nations may rise and fall, but an idea lives on. Ideas have endurance without death.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The Difficulty Lies Not So Much In Developing New Ideas As In Escaping From Old Ones.
author: John Maynard Keynes

quote: Ideas are like rabbits. You get a couple, learn how to handle them, and pretty soon you have a dozen.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: Others go to bed with their mistresses; I with my ideas.
author: José Marti, letter, 1890

quote: Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas.
author: Joseph Stalin

quote: An artist paints, dances, draws, writes, designs, or acts at the expanding edge of consciousness. We press into the unknown rather than the known. This makes life lovely and lively.
author: Julia Cameron

quote: Lack of money is no obstacle. Lack of an idea is an obstacle.
author: Ken Hakuta

quote: The most important thing about creativity is that you honor your creativity, and you don’t ever ignore it or go against what that creative image is telling you.
author: Lady Gaga

quote: You can have brilliant ideas, but if you can't get them across, your ideas won't get you anywhere.
author: Lee Iacocca

quote: The best way to have good ideas is to have lots of ideas.
author: Linus Pauling

quote: The only people in the world who can change things are those who can sell ideas.
author: Lois Wyse

quote: Language is the means of getting an idea from my brain into yours without surgery.
author: Mark Amidon

quote: The man with a new idea is a crank -- until the idea succeeds.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Ideas corrode the international fences.
author: Martin H. Fischer (1879–1962)

quote: You can't beat ideas — political, social, economic or religious — with implements.
author: Martin H. Fischer (1879–1962)

quote: A mediocre idea that generates enthusiasm will go further than a great idea that inspires no one.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: Creativity is inventing, experimenting, growing, taking risks, breaking rules, making mistakes, and having fun.
author: Mary Lou Cook

quote: You can kill a man, but you can't kill an idea.
author: Medgar Evers

quote: When you write down your ideas you automatically focus your full attention on them. Few if any of us can write one thought and think another at the same time. Thus a pencil and paper make excellent concentration tools.
author: Michael Leboeuf

quote: No matter how brilliantly an idea is stated, we will not really be moved unless we have already half thought of it ourselves.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: No matter how brilliantly an idea is stated, we will not really be moved unless we have already half-thought of it ourselves.
author: Mignon McLaughlin, The Neurotic's Notebook, 1960

quote: All achievements, all earned riches, have their beginning in an idea.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: Everyone who’s ever taken a shower has an idea. It’s the person who gets out of the shower, dries off and does something about it who makes a difference.
author: Nolan Bushnell

quote: Everyone who's ever taken a shower has an idea. It's the person who gets out of the shower, dries off and does something about it who makes a difference.
author: Nolan Bushnell

quote: One's mind, once stretched by a new idea, never regains its original dimensions.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quote: An idea that is not dangerous is unworthy of being called an idea at all.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A new idea is delicate. It can be killed by a sneer or a yawn; it can be stabbed to death by a quip and worried to death by a frown on the right man's brow.
author: Ovid

quote: Money never starts an idea. It is always the idea that starts the money.
author: Owen Laughlin

quote: You have to have an idea of what you are going to do, but it should be a vague idea.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: I begin with an idea and then it becomes something else.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Adults Are Always Asking Little Kids What They Want To Be When They Grow Up Because They're Looking For Ideas.
author: Paula Poundstone

quote: It is a lesson which all history teaches wise men, to put trust in ideas, and not in circumstances.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A painter told me that nobody could draw a tree without in some sort becoming a tree; or draw a child by studying the outlines of its form merely… but by watching for a time his motions and plays, the painter enters into his nature and can then draw him at every attitude…
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: No Matter What People Tell You, Words And Ideas Can Change The World.
author: Robin Williams

quote: If you do not express your own original ideas, if you do not listen to your own being, you will have betrayed yourself.
author: Rollo May

quote: After years of telling corporate citizens to 'trust the system', many companies must relearn instead to trust their people and encourage them to use neglected creative capacities in order to tap the most potent economic stimulus of all: idea power.
author: Rosabeth Moss Kanter

quote: Our best ideas come from clerks and stockboys.
author: Sam Walton

quote: I had a monumental idea this morning, but I didn’t like it.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

quote: Big thoughts are fun to romanticize, but it’s many small insights coming together that bring big ideas into the world.
author: Scott Berkun

quote: You don't make progress by standing on the sidelines, whimpering and complaining. You make progress by implementing ideas.
author: Shirley Chisholm

quote: Men are strong only so long as they represent a strong idea. They become powerless when they oppose it.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: An original idea. That can't be too hard. The library must be full of them.
author: Stephen Fry

quote: To turn really interesting ideas and fledgling technologies into a company that can continue to innovate for years, requires a lot of discipline.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life – think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success, that is way great spiritual giants are produced.
author: Swami Vivekananda

quote: Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life. Think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success. That is way great spiritual giants are produced.
author: Swami Vivekananda

quote: Let your working ideas go for a picnic — sometimes the fresh air and ant bites are just what they need. Many great ideas were bitten a little at the beginning.
author: Terri Guillemets

quote: Nearly every man who develops an idea works it up to the point where it looks impossible, and then he gets discouraged. That's not the place to become discouraged.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: If you are possessed by an idea, you find it expressed everywhere, you even smell it.
author: Thomas Mann

quote:
The great accomplishments of man have resulted from the 
 transmission of ideas of enthusiasm.
author: Thomas Watson

quote: The new idea either finds a champion or it dies. No ordinary involvement with a new idea provides the energy required to cope with the indifference and resistance that change provokes.
author: Tom Peters

quote: There Is One Thing Stronger Than All The Armies In The World, And That Is An Idea Whose Time Has Come.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: An invasion of armies can be resisted, but not an idea whose time has come.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Ideas can no more flow backward than can a river.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: The wings of change always flutter on the fire of ideas.
author: Viswo Varenya Samal

quote: Get a good idea and stay with it. Dog it, and work at it until it’s done right.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Around here, we don’t look backwards for very long. We keep moving forward, opening up new doors and doing new things, because we’re curious… and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths.
author: Walt Disney

quote: You do things when the opportunities come along. I've had periods in my life when I've had a bundle of ideas come along, and I've had long dry spells. If I get an idea next week, I'll do something. If not, I won't do a damn thing.
author: Warren Buffet

quote: Money never starts an idea; it is the idea that starts the money.
author: William J. Cameron

quote: No Idea Is So Outlandish That It Should Not Be Considered With A Searching But At The Same Time A Steady Eye.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: No idea is so outlandish that it should not be considered.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Right now it's only a notion, but I think I can get the money to make it into a concept, and later turn it into an idea.
author: Woody Allen
